hero.title: AGENTS.md
hero.subtitle: A simple, open format for guiding coding agents, {br} used by over {link}.
hero.description: Think of AGENTS.md as a {strong}: a dedicated, predictable place to provide the context and instructions to help AI coding agents work on your project.

why.title: Why AGENTS.md?
why.paragraph1: README.md files are for humans: quick starts, project descriptions, and contribution guidelines.
why.paragraph2: AGENTS.md complements this by containing the extra, sometimes detailed context coding agents need: build steps, tests, and conventions that might clutter a README or aren't relevant to human contributors.
why.paragraph3: We intentionally kept it separate to:
why.reason1Title: Give agents a clear, predictable place for instructions.
why.reason2Title: Keep READMEs concise and focused on human contributors.
why.reason3Title: Provide precise, agent-focused guidance that complements existing README and docs.
why.paragraph4: Rather than introducing another proprietary file, we chose a name and format that could work for anyone. If you're building or using coding agents and find this helpful, feel free to adopt it.

compatibility.subtitle: Your agent definitions are compatible with a growing ecosystem of AI coding agents and tools:

howToUse.title: How to use AGENTS.md?
howToUse.step1Body: Create an AGENTS.md file at the root of the repository. Most coding agents can even scaffold one for you if you ask nicely.
howToUse.step2Body: Add sections that help an agent work effectively with your project. Popular choices:
howToUse.step3Body: Commit messages or pull request guidelines, security gotchas, large datasets, deployment steps: anything you'd tell a new teammate belongs here too.
howToUse.step4Title: Large monorepo? Use nested AGENTS.md files for subprojects
howToUse.step4Body: Place another AGENTS.md inside each package. Agents automatically read the nearest file in the directory tree, so the closest one takes precedence and every subproject can ship tailored instructions. For example, at time of writing the main OpenAI repo has 88 AGENTS.md files.

about.title: About
about.paragraph1: AGENTS.md emerged from collaborative efforts across the AI software development ecosystem, including {openai}, {amp}, {jules}, {cursor}, and {factory}.
about.paragraph2: We're committed to helping maintain and evolve this as an open format that benefits the entire developer community, regardless of which coding agent you use.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.answer1: No. AGENTS.md is just standard Markdown. Use any headings you like; the agent simply parses the text you provide.
faq.answer2: The closest AGENTS.md to the edited file wins; explicit user chat prompts override everything.
